de.heidelberg.cl.ap.ss13.helper

Class Configure

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.heidelberg.cl.ap.ss13.helper.Configure

  • public class Configure
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that handles the configuration for the word alignment
    Author:
    Carolin Haas (carhaas1@gmail.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Configure(java.lang.String path_config_file)
      Initializes the Configure object with the configuration options taken from the specified configuration file The configuration file should have the following format: every line contains one key value pair. keys and values are split with ":" Required keys: source, target, output, root_dir Optional keys: ibm1, hmm, null_token, clean_up, reverse_order, log_prob, number_reducers For more details see the help message of the main program or the documentation

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getCleanUp()
      returns whether or not the temporary files (on the normal file system as well as the HDFS) should be deleted.
      int getHMM()
      returns the value of how many HMM iterations there should be at maximum.
      int getIBM1()
      returns the value of how many IBM 1 iterations there should be at maximum.
      boolean getLogProb()
      returns whether or not the probabilities should be in log space.
      boolean getNullToken()
      returns whether or not a null token should be inserted.
      int getNumberRedcuers()
      returns the number of reducers that should be used.
      java.lang.String getOutput()
      returns the file location of where the output file containing the viterbi alignment for the given parallel corpus should be written
      boolean getReverseOrder()
      returns whether or not source and target languages should be reversed.
      java.lang.String getRootDir()
      returns the file location of the specified root dir.
      java.lang.String getSource()
      returns the file location of the source language corpus
      java.lang.String getTarget()
      returns the file location of the target language corpus
      void setSource(java.lang.String new_source)
      sets the file location of the source language corpus should only be used for reversing the order
      void setTarget(java.lang.String new_target)
      sets the file location of the target language corpus should only be used for reversing the order

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Configure

        public Configure(java.lang.String path_config_file)
        Initializes the Configure object with the configuration options taken from the specified configuration file The configuration file should have the following format: every line contains one key value pair. keys and values are split with ":" Required keys: source, target, output, root_dir Optional keys: ibm1, hmm, null_token, clean_up, reverse_order, log_prob, number_reducers For more details see the help message of the main program or the documentation
        Parameters:
        path_config_file - the file location of the configuration file

    • Method Detail

      • setSource

        public void setSource(java.lang.String new_source)
        sets the file location of the source language corpus should only be used for reversing the order
        Parameters:
        new_source - the new file location of the source language corpus

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(java.lang.String new_target)
        sets the file location of the target language corpus should only be used for reversing the order
        Parameters:
        new_target - the new file location of the target language corpus

      • getSource

        public java.lang.String getSource()
        returns the file location of the source language corpus
        Returns:
        String the string which contains the file location of the source language corpus

      • getTarget

        public java.lang.String getTarget()
        returns the file location of the target language corpus
        Returns:
        String the string which contains the file location of the target language corpus

      • getOutput

        public java.lang.String getOutput()
        returns the file location of where the output file containing the viterbi alignment for the given parallel corpus should be written
        Returns:
        String the string of where the output file should be written

      • getRootDir

        public java.lang.String getRootDir()
        returns the file location of the specified root dir. The root dir will be used to as the location to save some temporary files
        Returns:
        String the string of where the root dir is located

      • getIBM1

        public int getIBM1()
        returns the value of how many IBM 1 iterations there should be at maximum. The default value is 5.
        Returns:
        int the maximum number of IBM 1 iterations

      • getHMM

        public int getHMM()
        returns the value of how many HMM iterations there should be at maximum. The default value is 5.
        Returns:
        int the maximum number of HMM iterations

      • getNullToken

        public boolean getNullToken()
        returns whether or not a null token should be inserted. True if the null token should be inserted, false else. Default is false.
        Returns:
        boolean whether or not a null token should be inserted

      • getCleanUp

        public boolean getCleanUp()
        returns whether or not the temporary files (on the normal file system as well as the HDFS) should be deleted. True if they should be deleted, false if the temporary files should remain. Default is true.
        Returns:
        boolean whether or not the temporary files should be deleted

      • getReverseOrder

        public boolean getReverseOrder()
        returns whether or not source and target languages should be reversed. True if the order should be inversed, false else. Default is true.
        Returns:
        boolean whether or not source and target languages should be reversed

      • getLogProb

        public boolean getLogProb()
        returns whether or not the probabilities should be in log space. True if log space should be used, false else. Default is true.
        Returns:
        boolean whether or not the log space should be used

      • getNumberRedcuers

        public int getNumberRedcuers()
        returns the number of reducers that should be used. Default value is 1.
        Returns:
        int return the number of reducers to be used
